thread.title: Great cruise deals you should book this week
thread.title_full: Great cruise deals you should book this week | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The Advertiser

author: Brad Crouch
title: Great cruise deals you should book this week
text:
CARNIVAL Corporation will begin cruises to Cuba from next May following approval from the US Department of the Treasury and the US Department of Commerce. The cruise giant will use its newly launched “fathom” brand – a new social impact travel brand providing purpose-oriented, social impact experiences. Fathom itineraries will comply with US Department of Treasury rules that allow licensed travel companies to transport approved travellers to Cuba to engage in activities that support the Cuban people.
Beginning in April 2016, fathom will embark on weekly seven-day voyages from Port Miami aboard the 710-guest Adonia . Fathom’s first impact destination will be the northern region of the Dominican Republic, followed by Dominican and Cuban itineraries on a regular basis.
Prices for the seven-day trip to the Dominican Republic start at US$1540 ($2069) a person, which includes on-board social impact immersion experiences and three onshore social impact activities. Prices for seven-day itineraries to Cuba start at $US2990 a person, excluding taxes, which also covers cultural immersion activities.
See fathom.org
 Cruise Erope on the river ship Sound of Music. Source: Supplied
BASEL TO AMSTERDAM
SPICE up life with a romantic river cruise package taking in Paris and Bruges, departing in July and August next year.
A $2499 a person package – a discount of $2050 a person – valid until July 31 covers a 10- night holiday on a charter of the river ship Sound of Music starting in Basel and cruising to Breisach, Strasbourg and Speyer, the lively village of Rudesheim then Koblenz at the meeting point of the Rhine and Moselle rivers. Visit Cologne before ending the cruise in Amsterdam. Then travel to the Belgian capital of Brussels, Bruges and Paris. The package covers seven nights on the ship, one night in Bruges and two nights in Paris.
Ph 1300 653 618 or see gate1travel.com.au
START IN THE LION CITY
SAIL from Singapore to Sydney on a luxury cruise on Celebrity Millennium on a 17-night package priced from $1749 a person, twin-share. The trip starts with a flight to Singapore and a night in the Lion City for shopping and sightseeing, then a 16-night cruise calling at Benoa in Bali for two days, Darwin, Cairns, Brisbane and Sydney.
Ph 1300 596 345 or see cruise1st.com.au
 Enjoy a movie or two on the Celebrity Solstice. Source: Supplied
FOR THE MOVIE FANS
FILM buffs, pack your bags. Movie critics David Stratton and Margaret Pomeranz will host a 14-night New Zealand cruise aboard Celebrity Solstice and each day the star duo will take over the ship’s cinema for a private screening of one of their favourite movies, followed by an open discussion. The best of NZ’s North and South islands will be on show on the cruise, including Milford Sound, Rotorua’s thermal springs and the stunning Bay of Islands. Priced from $4750 a person, twin-share, this escorted 16-day round trip departs Sydney on January 5, 2016 and includes a 14-night cruise from Sydney to New Zealand, airfare from New Zealand back to Sydney/Melbourne/Brisbane, one night in Auckland and sightseeing tours of Melbourne, Hobart, Dunedin, Akaroa, Wellington, Tauranga, Bay of Islands and Auckland.
Ph 1800 630 343 or see travelrite.com.au
UPGRADE FOR FREE
BOOK by July 31 and receive a free double upgrade and a bonus US$200 credit each stateroom on a 16-night voyage aboard the 3115-guest Explorer of the Seas . Departing Fremantle on November 13 this year, the trip calls at Adelaide and Melbourne, then crosses the Tasman to visit Milford, Doubtful and Dusky sounds, Dunedin, Picton and Wellington, then Sydney Harbour for an overnight on board before disembarking. Fares from $1799 a person, twin-share, with an upgrade from an inside stateroom to balcony cabin.
See cruising.com.au
SILVER-LINING SAILING
CAN’T decide between a river or ocean cruise? Do both on a package departing April 5, 2016. The deal includes a flight to Rome and two nights’ hotel stay, a seven-night Rome to Nice cruise aboard the luxurious all-suite Silverseas’ Silver Cloud , two nights in a hotel, flight to Lyon then a seven-night river cruise to Avignon aboard Uniworld’s Catherine . A flight to Paris for three nights’ accommodation follows before the flight home. The 21-night package is priced from $12,499 a person, twin share, and includes a bonus of up to $400 off for each couple, twin-share, if booked by July 31.
Ph 1300 362 599 or see creativecruising.com.au
Originally published as Sail to Cuba and make an impact
